revised_title: Investigations into Induced Contractions and Electric Discharges in Muscles
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand the nature of induced contractions in muscles and the role of electric discharges in muscle contractions. They discovered that induced contractions are exclusive to the muscle in the state of contraction and that the phenomenon is not explained by an electric discharge similar to a jar discharge. The author also found that a coating of turpentine does not affect the electric discharge through a muscle, but prevents induced contractions. Further research is needed to understand the origin of these phenomena.
